meta_description.text: 2 : a danger or difficulty that is hidden or is not easily recognized He soon learned the pitfalls of publishing. More from Merriam-Webster on pitfall. Nglish:Â ...

meta_description.text: pitfall | American Dictionary ... an unexpected danger or difficulty: Who knows what kind of pitfalls they're going to run into.

meta_description.title: Pitfall definition and meaning | Collins English Dictionary
meta_description.text: The pitfalls involved in a particular activity or situation are the things that may go wrong or may cause problems. The pitfalls of working abroad are numerous.20-Mar-2018 Â· Uploaded by Collins A-Z

meta_description.title: pitfall - Dictionary Definition : Vocabulary.com
meta_description.text: A pitfall is a trap or difficulty you didn't see. A possible pitfall for high school seniors is not working hard after they know they've already beenÂ ...

meta_description.title: Pitfall Definition & Meaning | Dictionary.com
meta_description.text: Pitfall definition, a lightly covered and unnoticeable pit prepared as a trap for people or animals. See more.

meta_description.title: PITFALL | Meaning & Definition for UK English | Lexico.com
meta_description.text: 1A hidden or unsuspected danger or difficulty. 'the pitfalls of buying goods at public auctions'. More example sentences.

meta_description.title: PITFALL (noun) definition and synonyms | Macmillan Dictionary
meta_description.text: Definition of PITFALL (noun): problem that is likely to happen.

people_also_ask.question: What is a common pitfall?
people_also_ask.heading: a problem that is likely to happen in a particular situation. She was well aware of the potential pitfalls of running a business. avoid a pitfall: Her advice helped me avoid some of the common pitfalls.
people_also_ask.title: PITFALL (noun) definition and synonyms | Macmillan Dictionary

people_also_ask.question: How do you use pitfall in a sentence?
people_also_ask.heading: Pitfall in a Sentence ðŸ”‰
people_also_ask.title: Pitfall: In a Sentence
snippet_data: The experienced programmer did not expect the pitfall that would occur when trying to install the new software.
Walking carelessly into the polices' pitfall led to the crook's arrest.
The dieter's pitfall appeared in the form of a buy one get one free ice cream sale.

people_also_ask.question: What is the opposite of pitfall?
people_also_ask.heading: Opposite of a hidden problem, danger or disadvantage in an apparently ideal situation. benefit. advantage. blessing. convenience.
people_also_ask.title: What is the opposite of pitfall? - WordHippo

knowledge_panel.description: pitfall! is a platform video game designed by david crane for the atari 2600 and released by activision in 1982. the player controls pitfall harry and is tasked with collecting all the treasures in a jungle within 20 minutes. the world consists of 255 screens which are horizontally connected in a flip screen manner. wikipedia

def_list.definition: a hidden or unsuspected danger or difficulty.
def_list.example: "the pitfalls of buying goods at public auctions"
